keyTakeAways: Christopher Moynihan, a former January 6 Capitol rioter, was arrested on a charge of threatening to kill Democratic House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries.
Moynihan was previously convicted of obstructing an official proceeding and disorderly conduct at the Capitol and sentenced to nearly two years in prison.
President Donald Trump pardoned Moynihan earlier in 2025, which drew criticism from Jeffries for enabling threats against public officials.
Moynihan allegedly made text messages threatening to kill Jeffries, stating he would eliminate him 'for the future' and that Jeffries was a 'terrorist'.
Law enforcement suspects Moynihan of drug abuse and increased homicidal ideation, which may relate to his recent threats.
A New York judge has ordered Moynihan to remain in prison while awaiting a hearing on whether he can be released pending trial on the terroristic threat charge.
Moynihan’s past addiction to opiates and political engagement during the Trump administration are cited in legal filings as background factors.
The case reflects heightened concern over political violence, especially following recent high-profile assassinations such as that of Charlie Kirk.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man convicted of participating in the January 6, 2021 Capitol attack, Christopher Moynihan, was arrested on a charge of threatening to kill Democratic House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries. Despite being pardoned by President Donald Trump earlier in 2025, Moynihan made threatening statements, including claims he would kill Jeffries 'for the future' and that Jeffries was a 'terrorist.' Law enforcement has raised concerns over Moynihan’s drug use and homicidal ideations. He remains in prison awaiting a hearing on whether to be released pending trial on a terroristic threat charge. The case reflects broader concerns about political violence, especially after the recent assassination of right-wing commentator Charlie Kirk, and underscores tensions between political accountability and presidential pardons.
title: Pardoned Capitol rioter arrested on charge that he threatened to kill Hakeem Jeffries
